They would never make Java worse so it matches Bedrock, so why make Bedrock worse to match Java? This anti-consumer behavior is just rotten.

If I wanted to play Java, I'd play Java. I want my horse growth stages and everything else distinctly Bedrock.

If you're going to focus on "parity" give us something nice, like the off hand!
It would also be cool if the copper golem had slower and slower movement speeds the more oxidized it is.
Yeah I agree, it is about time we get a crucial parity that could help a lot of us.

Right on! This is exactly my first thought when I heard that hardcore mode was coming to Bedrock. This NEEDS to be changed! There are simply too many situations in Bedrock where death could have been avoided had Java Editions healing existed, and with hardcore mode coming soon there's pretty much no better time to implement this. I could be wrong but I'm pretty sure even the legacy console editions of Minecraft had healing equivalent to Java Edition. Like seriously, not having it by now in Bedrock is actually kind of ridiculous if i'm being real.
I agree, this really should be added to survival mode on Bedrock Edition as a whole.
